abstract: Amanda Knox, the American student convicted of killing her roommate in Italy four years ago, delivered a tearful statement in Italian before an appeals court on Monday, asking that her conviction be overturned.
snippet: Amanda Knox, the American student convicted of killing her roommate in Italy four years ago, delivered a tearful statement in Italian before an appeals court on Monday, asking that her conviction be overturned.
lead_paragraph: 5:23 p.m. | Updated As my colleague Elisabetta Povoledo reports from Perugia, Italy, Amanda Knox, the American student jailed in the killing her roommate while both were studying abroad in Italy four years ago, was freed on Monday after an Italian appeals court overturned the her conviction and that of her Italian co-defendant.

headline.main: Video and Translation of Knox's Statement in Italian Court
